net.hudup.core.logistic

Class Vector

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.logistic.Vector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, TextParsable

    public class Vector
extends java.lang.Object
implements Cloneable, TextParsable, java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a vector of double values. The Java built-in java.util.Vector is the more general one. So the use of this class is restricted but it provides some useful statistical methods for calculating mean, standard error, correlation coefficient, etc. Some other arithmetic methods for calculating add, subtract, multiply, divide, product, cosine, etc. are also useful. This class contains an internal array of double values data.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public double module()
        Calculating the module (length) of this vector. For example, the module of vector (3, 4) is Sqrt(3^2 + 4^2) = 5.
        Returns:
